subject: Medicine
title: Informed Consent
description: A micro-lesson that makes Informed Consent usable.

hook.text: A patient signs a consent form without reading it. Is that informed consent? Legally, maybe. Ethically, no.

buildup.text: Informed consent requires that patients understand the risks, benefits, and alternatives before agreeing.

discovery.text: It's not just a signatureâ€”it's an ongoing conversation ensuring the patient truly comprehends what's happening.

twist.text: Studies show most patients don't understand the consent forms they signâ€”the language is too complex.

climax.text: True informed consent means patients can explain back what they agreed to in their own words.

punchline.text: A signature isn't consent. Understanding is.

quiz.question: What is the true standard for informed consent?
options: The patient genuinely understands risks, benefits, and alternatives
The patient signs a legal document before treatment
The doctor explains procedures in medical terminology
